item.title: Two vim tips I hope to actually remember this time
item.description: Read from an external command into the current buffer :read prints the results of an external command into the current buffer. Example :read ! cat /etc/passwd will copy the /etc/passwd file into the current buffer. Pasting yanked text into the command input Yank a word (e.g. yw to yank the word under the cursor) Enter the vim command line via : Ctrl-R, " to paste from the default register.
